pros: Very true to the mission! Very supportive work environment
cons: Not as much career growth due to be very small in size.
the pay per hour is not high

job_title: Senior Admissions Advisor in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Small knit company and you get to know the people you work with very quickly.
cons: Hard to move up due to amount of positions offered.

pros: Mostly a good group of people, free degrees/certs, good work/life balance
cons: Annual raises that were below the inflation rate, repeated dangling of promotions if you just take on "one more responsibility," but they never materialize even when you excel at said responsibility.

pros: When I started, everyone was great, seemed  like a great place.   Most of the people are very nice and everyone was welcoming.   Nice location, so its an easy commute.  Some areas are more relaxed than others on start and end times which is pretty cool.
cons: I dont see much positive energy at all throughout and its a high Stress levels that hits pretty fast.     There are the privileged that  are given free reign as managers, and others are not prepared at all to be leaders, but given the role for unknown reasons.    Benefits are ok, with the exception of tuition reimbursement.  Pretty sad considering this is a college.

review_title: I am disappointed with how Peirce College treats its faculty.
pros: You get to work from home as a faculty member, and that is good because the school is located in Center City Philadelphia where parking is expensive and commutes are unpredictable.
cons: They cheat on salaries and expectations just like a student cheats.  What do I mean by this?  They hire you for one thing, and at a low, low salary, then they chip away at you by asking to do this, that, and the other thing that are all way beyond what you were hired to do.  They want it on the cheap.  It is just like a student asking for an A when they perform at the C level.

review_title: When change isnt really the change you hoped it would be
pros: Working from my home.  No micro-managing.  Flexibility and a decent workload.
cons: No direct leadership.  Management is inconsistent .  No sense of community anymore, dont feel I belong, and there is no real place for us to socialize anymore.   Focus on the bottom line trumps everything, even in a grow period, all we hear is this has been cut, and thats a great idea but who will pay for it.

review_title: Glory Days are Gone, along with the culture
pros: Location in Center City. Free tuition @ Peirce
cons:
For such a small organization, the favoritism and politics run deep.  Allowed from the top , down.  No growth for advancement. Lack of leadership and direction.
Management is green and lacks higher education experience.  
Bully management , or avoidance style. 
No tuition program outside of Peirce
Benefits keeps shrinking along with annual pay increases

pros: A very intellectual, experienced and talented group of staff from the Administration to the instructors.  Peirce provides everything a student needs to be successful from the availability of staff, instructors to the tutors at the Walker Center.
cons: I cannot think of a con at the present time.

review_title: Not What I expected or hoped for in working for a College
pros: Center City location, easy commute, People you work with are nice.  Area around the building is pretty safe.
cons:
Not Education focused.
You do the work of 2 plus people as they keep shrinking the workforce with shrinking enrollment.
Tuition Reimbursement very poor for an Institute of Higher Learning
No Tuition Exchange with Other Colleges
Benefits Shrinking
No opportunity for advancement
No parking

pros: Colleagues have great personalities and are easy to work with.
cons: Salary is too low considering the work and degree level required.

pros: Free tuition. You get a lot of time off. Fun coworkers.
cons: Too many upper management. They are out if touch. No room for advancement.
